roleset.name: get, coming to possess/become acquainted with
roleset.note: RECEIVE-V NOTES: Based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with get and gain; 'received' based on BOLT-1. Member of Vncls obtain-13.5.2. (from receive.01-v)
RECEPTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on receive-v.01, noun corpus. Corresponds to VNcls obtain-13.5.2. (from reception.01-n)
RECEIVED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from received.01-j)
RECD-V NOTES: Abbreviation added by Julia for THYME.

roles.note: see the 4th, 5th and 8th examples to see why arg4 was apparently added, and to see when to use it. (from receive.01-v) args 3-price and 4-secondary attribute omitted due to expected lack of need in nominalizations. (from reception.01-n)

example.name: receive-v: basic
example.text: Edison customers have received electric service since April 1985.

example.name: receive-v: as exchange
example.text: Stockholders will receive one Cray Computer share for every two Cray Research shares they own in a distribution.
example.arg: for every two Cray Research shares they own

example.name: receive-v: with giver
example.text: Anyone can receive more than $10k in cash from a client in one or more related transactions.
example.arg: in one or more related transactions

example.name: receive-v: ex 4: where arg4 is necessary
example.text: The company hadn't yet received any documents from OSHA regarding the penalty or fine.

example.name: receive-v: ex 5: another attribute
example.text: Georgia Gulf received a new takeover bid from investor Harold Simmons of $50 million a share.

example.name: receive-v: Medical: Arg1 as medication
example.text: Should a patient with diverticulitis and previous radiation of adrenal glands receive steroids?
example.arg: a patient with diverticulitis and previous radiation of adrenal glands

example.name: receive-v: Medical: Arg1 as treatment
example.text: Patients who-1 *T*-1 receive chemotherapy frequently develop anemia.

example.name: receive-v: with attribute as part of arg1, as it should be
example.text: Clinton Gas Systems Inc. said it received a contract *ICH*-1 from Timken Co. , Canton , Ohio , [to manage the natural gas purchasing , scheduling and transportation activities for Timken 's seven Ohio and two Pennsylvania plants]-1 .

example.name: received-j
example.text: A grocery store cake with Thank You written across it . That should be fairly inexpensive and well received . :-RRB- If you are going in the AM maybe some donuts and kolaches from a local donut shop .

example.name: reception-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: So far , the critical reception for cyber-literature in book form has not been great

example.name: reception-n: arg0
example.text: she did not really get too much of a reception from Bashar Al - Assad in terms of lightening the traditionally antagonistic Syrian align towards Israel .

example.name: reception-n: MNR
example.text: I think I will get a very positive reception .

example.name: reception-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: After reception of the package from the other school, a debriefing session is organized to discover and analyze their artworks.
